column2: Better Looking Garbs

Welcome to using Better Looking Garbs.\nTo complete the installation and gain full integration with available DLC assets you should use the BLG installer.\nRun betterlookinggarbsinstall.exe in Documents\Paradox Interactive\Crusader Kings II\mod or bundled in betterlookinggarbs.zip. See the readme file for the full instructions.
I will do this.
Sicilian

On a quest
This character has an active society quest
§ZBLG:§! New Character Variation
New character ethnicities will be varied based on the populations within or near the realm they come from. Both the current population and the historical inhabitants will be represented.
New character ethnicities will be varied based on the populations within or near the realm they come from. No culture or region specific options will be used.
New character ethnicities will NOT be altered.
§ZBLG:§! Newborn Child Handling
Newborn children can get a different ethnicity representing the midpoint between their parents. Similar ethnicities will be shifted to the child's culture.
Newborn children can get a different ethnicity representing the midpoint between their parents.
Primary Parent
Newborn children will take after the primary parent in a marriage. The father in a regular marriage and vice versa. This setting takes player choice over realism.
Newborn children will NOT be altered.
§ZBLG:§! Child Portraits
Until age 16
Until age 15
Until age 14
Child portraits will grow with age until the switch to adult portraits.
Until age 16, No size scaling
Until age 15, No size scaling
Until age 14, No size scaling
Child portraits will show at full size until the switch to adult portraits.
§ZBLG:§! Traits
Effects for various traits will be shown in the character portrait.
No Lunatic and Possessed
Effects for lunatic and possessed characters will be excluded from showing in the character portrait.
No Makeup
Effects for attractive, groomed, lunatic and possessed characters will be excluded from showing in the character portrait.
No Traits
Custom effects from traits will be excluded from showing in the character portrait.
Effects for traits and diseases will be NOT shown in the character portrait. Effects from overweight and harelipped characters will NOT be shown in addition.
§ZBLG:§! Diseases
Effects for various diseases will be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for diseases will be shown in the character portrait. Diseases will persist after death.
Effects for diseases will NOT be shown in the character portrait.
Post Mortem
§ZBLG:§! Wounds and Scars
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will be shown in the character portrait.
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will be shown in the character portrait. Wounds will persist after death.
No Disfigurement Masks
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will be shown in the character portrait. Disfigured characters will NOT wear masks.
No Wounds
Effects for wounded characters will NOT be shown in the character portrait. Scars will be shown. Disfigured characters will NOT wear masks.
Effects for wounded and scarred characters will NOT be shown in the character portrait. Characters will NOT wear masks or blindfolds.
§ZBLG:§! Helmets
Commanders at war will wear helmets. Marshals and captains will carry helmets.
Commanders, marshals and captains will always wear helmets.
Low Ranks only
Barons and lower rank commanders will wear helmets. Higher rank commanders will carry helmets.
Commanders, marshals and captains will NOT wear helmets, but carry them on their side.
No helmets will be shown in the character portrait.
§ZBLG:§! Artifacts
Weapons
Equipped artifacts and pets can be shown in the character portrait.
Only weapons and unique artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
Only rare and unique artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
No artifacts will be shown in the character portrait.
§ZBLG:§! Fade Dead Characters
Dead characters will have a faded portrait.
Dead characters will have a regular portrait.
